Ameren is charged with ongoing violation of the Clean Water Act due to continuing and ongoing unpermitted discharges into the river of toxic coal ash pollutants. Coal ash, a by-product of burning coal, contains multiple contaminants including mercury, boron, sulfate, cadmium, lead and arsenic.
